title: Newcastle 3 Wolves 0 - Instant Newcastle United fan / writer reaction
body_text:
Newcastle 3 Wolves 0 – Instant Newcastle United fan/writer reaction
Newcastle 3 Wolves 0 – Wednesday 15 January 2025 7.30pm
Instant fan / writer reaction from some of our regular contributors on The Mag.
Nat Seaton:
‘NINE in a row!!!
A thoroughly deserved win with Isak and Gordon getting the goals, but special mention (yet again) for Tonali, he is a joy to watch and just keeps getting better, how much more is there to come?!
Exciting times and what great football we’re playing, getting us to this point.
Can’t wait for Saturday, we all know what number win in a row that would be!!’
Billy Miller:
‘Alexander Isak, record breaker!
He’s secured the Newcastle United record for consecutive Premier League games scored in.
Now he must be eyeing Vardy’s overall record. We’ve got the fixtures for him to do it.
If we can keep him fit, he’s got every chance of the golden boot this season.
More importantly, we’ll have every chance of Champions League qualification.
We’ve hopped into 4th after dominating a toothless Wolves side.
It’s nine wins on the bounce now. The mighty Mags are absolutely flying.’
David Punton:
‘A ninth straight win and into the top four we go. We’re buzzing.
Immense from Isak yet again. Another two goals and an assist to top it off.
Wolves are battling for their Premier League lives so we had to be patient tonight. The chances came though and they went in.
We gave Wolves a fair few chances up the other end but they couldn’t take them and were thwarted by a stunning save from Dubravka and the VAR going our way too.
You could also say we have won well and there is still plenty of room to get even better than this.
That said, a 3-0 win is not to be sniffed at. I love this Newcastle team.’
GToon:
‘Amazing to see this winning run continue.
What a team we are.
Things are really coming together with the level of performance within the group.
It’s great to see we are giving players a break too, when the result is confirmed.
And who would have thought that Bournemouth on Saturday are probably going to be the toughest test of our run and it’s a top six clash.
Bizzare.’
The Armchair Fan:
‘Absolutely amazing!
Nine wins in a row, six in the league and three in the cups!
Top four, semi-final of one cup and fourth round of another.
Have we ever had things so good?!
Happy days! Roll on Saturday!’
Greg McPeake:
‘Local Portuguese bar and they are quite happy to put the Newcastle game on ahead of the North London derby.
Love the fact the self-entitled Arsenal lot think they can buy whoever.
Isak doing the business again, rubbing their noses in it.
A comfortable win and though Wolves worked hard the lads were in control.’
Mark Jankowski:
‘Wolves came into the game having seen an upturn in their performances since having appointed Pereira as manager.
To Wolves’ credit they gave a confident and spirited performance and if they’d had a striker with half as much finishing ability as our number 14, it may have been a much closer game.
Ultimately Newcastle’s quality shone through in a game that wasn’t a classic.
Two more goals for Isak (one had a significant deflection) and another for Gordon sealed the points.
I’ve got a feeling it winning run may end on Saturday but that’s a worry for another day, for now I’ll enjoy being 4th.’
Tony Mallabar:
‘Don’t think I’ve been to a home league game midweek where I celebrated a first half goal so much.
Not because Isak got his 8th in a row goal. But because it was freezing and collectively half the east stand got up to empty our bladders.
It was a shame seeing one of England’s old founding clubs only fill two thirds of the away end.
If any Wolves fans reading this think am having a pop, totally not. Just shame to see the current malaise in how match day fans are treated, a midweek January trip to Newcastle cannot be the easiest to attend.
But never mind, we have now won 8 in a row, so an even more must win game on Saturday against a team we’ve never beaten in the Premier League under NGE’s tutelage.’
Matt Busby said to Joe Harvey:
‘Job done.
We rode our luck at times and that was a game we might have lost earlier in the season. Momentum is everything.
Good use of the subs by Eddie.
Alex Isak is unplayable. How unselfish was he in setting up Anthony Gordon?
Big Dan Burn and Botman also fantastic this evening.’
Newcastle 3 Wolves 0 – Wednesday 15 January 2025 7.30pm
